title: Fairy Steps Beetham Walk Route

images.title: Stanley Street, Beetham by Ian Taylor, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Stanley Street, Beetham

images.title: John Berry / Fairy Steps
images.caption: Fairy Steps. A geological feature of limestone pavement. If you can reach the top of the steps without touching the sides then your wish will be granted. You need to be thin as a rake and very agile!

images.title: Michael Graham / Looking West from The Fairy Steps
images.caption: Looking West from The Fairy Steps. Arnside Knott beyond the trees

images.title: Michael Graham / Fairy Steps
images.caption: On the top of Whin Scar. The steps are in the cleft.

images.title: Dollywood Lane by Hugh Craddock, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dollywood Lane

images.caption: Cairn, Whin Scar

images.title: Adie Jackson / The Wheatsheaf at Beetham
images.caption: The Wheatsheaf at Beetham

images.title: Alexander P Kapp / Beetham Hall
images.caption: Beetham Hall. The Hall is a 14th-century fortified manor house, now largely ruined, adjoining later buildings. It lies to the south east of the village.

description: This pretty Cumbrian village sits within the Arnside and Silverdale AONB, close to the border with Lancashire. This circular walk from the village takes you to the wonderful limestone scenery at the Fairy Steps. The steps are located just west of the village and reacheable on the Limestone Link public footpath. The natural limestone staircase is a popular geological feature of the area. The challenge is to climb to the top of the narrow stairs without touching the sides. From the elevated position of the ridge there are some great views towards the Lake District mountains and the nearby Arnside Knott. The trail will then take you through Underlaid Wood before picking up Dollywood Lane and Leighton Beck Road to return you to the village.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Beetham Nurseries and Garden Centre is a lovely place for some post walk relaxation and refreshment. The centre has a fine cafe with a good range of meals and snacks. You can also enjoy a stroll around the fragrant gardens where you will find a splendid variety of plants and flowers. You can find them on Pool Darkin Lane with a postcode of LA7 7AP for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and hills make for a fine walk for fit dogs. The garden centre mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the north there's the neighbouring market town of Milnthorpe. Here you can enjoy a lovely walk along Milnthorpe Sands to the River Kent Estuary and the wonderful topiary at Levens Hall.
